snippet: “The Grand Budapest Hotel” uses a handmade miniature model for exterior shots in the film.
abstract: Wes Anderson's The Grand Budapest Hotel uses handmade miniature models for film's exterior shots; Anderson likes using miniatures in movie-making, saying that he feels audiences tend to recognize what is artificial, whether computer-generated or otherwise, giving him liberty to use models, which he prefers.
lead_paragraph: “The Grand Budapest Hotel” uses a handmade miniature model for exterior shots in the film.

headline.seo: The Miniature Model Behind ‘The Grand Budapest Hotel’
headline.main: You Can Look, but You Can’t Check In
headline.print_headline: You Can Look, but You Can’t Check In
